physical_appearance:This is a panaromic black-and-white photograph of Telok Ayer Bay from Mount Erskine. It features an elevated view down a street on the left
 with numerous roofed buildings. There is a view of the bay on the right
 with several ships scattered out at sea. The photograph is slightly faded
 and has several stain marks along the top. There is a vertical line across the center
 where photographs were stitched together. There is a title at the bottom of the photograph.

sgcool_label_text:This is a view from Mount Erskine
 looking down Amoy Street. The roof of the Chinese temple
 Thian Hock Keng
 features in the foreground
 while St Andrew\u0027s Cathedral
 the Court House and the Empress Place Building are faintly visible in the background. Telok Ayer Bay is shown on the right of the image
 with the old Telok Ayer market along the coast
 and a scattering of ships further out at sea.

metadata.title_text: Two-part panoramic view of Telok Ayer Bay from Mount Erskine
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a panaromic black-and-white photograph of Telok Ayer Bay from Mount Erskine. It features an elevated view down a street on the left, with numerous roofed buildings. There is a view of the bay on the right, with several ships scattered out at sea. The photograph is slightly faded, and has several stain marks along the top. There is a vertical line across the center, where photographs were stitched together. There is a title at the bottom of the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_1: panoramic photography aerial views aerial photographs
metadata.subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Photography, Panoramic Singapore Thian Hock Keng (Singapore) Empress Place (Singapore) Aerial views Aerial photographs
metadata.subject_terms_3: Photography Mount Erskine Amoy Street Thian Hock Keng Telok Ayer Basin St Andrew's Cathedral Empress Place Building Former Supreme Court (Singapore)
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a view from Mount Erskine, looking down Amoy Street. The roof of the Chinese temple, Thian Hock Keng, features in the foreground, while St Andrew's Cathedral, the Court House and the Empress Place Building are faintly visible in the background. Telok Ayer Bay is shown on the right of the image, with the old Telok Ayer market along the coast, and a scattering of ships further out at sea.
